definition: to go through (a district) or go to (persons) in order to solicit orders or political support or to determine opinions or sentiments
examples: canvassed the neighborhood to solicit magazine subscriptions

definition: to examine in detail, to examine (votes) officially for authenticity

examples: canvassed all the items on the agenda

definition: to toss in a canvas sheet in sport or punishment
to seek orders or votes : solicit
examples: was canvassing for a seat in Congress

definition: the act or an instance of canvassing, a personal solicitation of votes or survey of public opinion
examples: a house-to-house canvass to ascertain the vote before the election
